Anyone who has ever committed reckless driving is more of "an illegal" than someone who lives here without papers
This is like calling someone "an illegal" because they once got a traffic ticket. Reckless driving in fact is a criminal, not civil offense.
Calling someone "an illegal," i.e. defining their identity based on a civil infraction, is absurd
Reminder: being an immigrant in the US without legal authorization is a civil infraction, not a criminal offense
